meanings.sent1: I will carryback the book to the library tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She always carries back her dog when it runs too far.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful squirrel had to carryback its acorns multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The waves carryback memories of childhood summers.
meanings.sent5: The wind can carryback the scent of flowers from miles away.

meanings.definition: A deduction of a business loss from a previous year's income
meanings.sent1: The company applied for a carryback to reduce their tax liability.
meanings.sent2: The accountant explained the benefits of a carryback to the business owner.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected loss led to a significant carryback for the company.
meanings.sent4: The carryback helped offset the financial impact of a tough year.
meanings.sent5: The carryback was a lifesaver for the struggling business.

meanings.definition: A refund of taxes paid in a previous year
meanings.sent1: The carryback resulted in a welcome tax refund for the family.
meanings.sent2: Many individuals eagerly await their carryback each year.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected carryback brought a smile to their faces.
meanings.sent4: Receiving a carryback feels like a small financial victory.
meanings.sent5: The carryback provided much-needed relief to the taxpayers.
